alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued December 05 at 2:20AM PST until December 05 at 2:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...An extended period of sustained wave action is expected to continue through Wednesday morning as a series of fronts moves through the region, culminating in a period of very large breaking waves of 25 to 30 feet this afternoon into early Wednesday morning. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Coast and Curry County Coast. * WHEN...The Beach Hazards Statement is in effect until 2 PM PST this afternoon, with a High Surf Advisory from 2 PM this afternoon to 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Beaches will be hazardous places to be through the middle of the week. Jetties and rocks are not safe places to stand, and you will risk death if you are caught by waves on them. Beach erosion is possible. Sneaker waves can run up significantly farther on beaches than normal, including over rocks and jetties. These waves can suddenly knock people off of their feet and quickly pull them into the cold ocean waters, resulting in serious injury or death. Waves may also lift driftwood logs, trapping anyone caught underneath. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Stay away from the surf zone and off of jetties. Area beaches may become hazardous due to dangerous surf conditions. Avoid climbing on rocks and jetties. Stay away from the ocean and remain out of the water to avoid hazardous conditions.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast
